snippet: David H. Petraeus, the director of the C.I.A., resigned after an investigation into the possible compromise of a computer wound up uncovering an affair.
abstract: David H Petraeus, director of Central Intelligence Agency and one of America's most decorated four-star generals, resigns after FBI investigation uncovered evidence that he had been involved in extramarital affair with the co-author of his biography, Paula Broadwell; resignation represents remarkable fall from grace for Petraeus, and raises questions over whether the affair led to security lapses during his 14-month tenure at the CIA.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Peter Baker, Helene Cooper, Michael S. Schmidt, Eric Schmitt and Scott Shane.

lead_paragraph: David H. Petraeus, the director of the C.I.A., resigned after an investigation into the possible compromise of a computer wound up uncovering an affair.

headline.seo: Citing Affair, Petraeus Resigns as C.I.A. Director
headline.main: Petraeus Quits; Evidence of Affair Was Found by F.B.I.
headline.print_headline: Petraeus Resigns at C.I.A.; F.B.I. Discovered an Affair
